Since these events take place after the death of the deceased, your actions here, unfortunately, will not change anything.
"Poor thing. If she had forgiven her father earlier, this wouldn't have happened."

The parents of the deceased Taro Totomi died in the bombing of Herashima when Taro was 10 years old. He survived because his parents sent him to his grandmother a few days before the tragedy. The last memory of his parents was the broken vase and the reproaches of his father. When he was 15, Taro left the village for the big city. His grandmother gave him a blue suit that she had once made for his father. Taro got married. His wife was terminally ill, but gave birth to a son and a daughter. The children grew up convinced that their father had cheated on his terminally ill wife and taken the children to a new wife, leaving their mother to die alone. In fact, the dying woman asked her husband to marry her friend. She didn't want her children to see her agonizing death and grow up without a mother. Because of the traditions and cultural characteristics, they decided to keep it a secret from the children. On a tragic day, Taro was going to fly to his daughter to tell the truth. All these years she had not answered his letters. Unfortunately, he missed his flight. When he returned home, his second wife ran away in tears because she found a letter indicating his infidelity.Neither she or her husband knew that this letter was his daughter's revenge. When the second wife of the Tarot broke the vase on his father and left his life as there are only small pieces. He passed away with a handful of pills washed down with a glass of wine and a photograph of his dead first wife in his hand.

Important decisions:
A month ago - c: Taro was looking for pills to commit suicide, but found only vitamins that the pharmacist sold to his wife.
A week ago - b: When Taro's daughter finally read one of his writings, she found out the truth and decided to talk to him.
Three days ago - c: Taro's son had been worried about his father for a long time. After reading about suicides, he sent his father a book that could help him. After looking through several pages, Taro began to doubt his decision.
An hour and a half ago - c: Due to the persistence of the courier, Taro received a package from his son. So he remembered that there are people in the world for whom he is important.
